course_outcomes: Solve the system of homogeneous and non-homogeneous linear equations
Examine the nature of a quadratic form by transforming into a canonical form
Determine maxima and minima of multivariable functions
Evaluate areas and volumes using double, triple integrals

syllabus.title: Matrices
syllabus.topics: Rank of a matrix by Echelon form, Normal form, Cauchy–Binet formulae (without proof), Inverse of Non- singular matrices by Gauss-Jordan method, System of linear equations: Solving system of Homogeneous and Non-Homogeneous equations by Gauss elimination method, Jacobi and Gauss-Seidel Iteration Methods.

syllabus.title: Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and Orthogonal Transformation
syllabus.topics: Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and their properties, Diagonalization of a matrix, Cayley-Hamilton Theorem (without proof), Finding inverse and power of a matrix by Cayley-Hamilton Theorem, Quadratic forms and Nature of the Quadratic forms, Reduction of Quadratic form to Canonical forms by Orthogonal Transformation.

syllabus.title: Differential Calculus
syllabus.topics: Mean Value Theorems: Rolle’s theorem, Lagrange’s mean value theorem with their geometrical interpretation, Cauchy’s mean value theorem, Taylor’s and Maclaurin’s theorems with remainders (without proof), Problems and applications on the above theorems. Functions of Several Variables: Continuity and Differentiability, Partial derivatives, Total derivatives, Chain rule, Directional derivative, Taylor’s and Maclaurin’s series expansion of functions of two variables, Jacobians, Functional dependence, Maxima and Minima of functions of two variables, Method of Lagrange multipliers.

syllabus.title: Multiple Integrals (Multivariable Calculus)
syllabus.topics: Double integrals,Triple integrals, Change of order of integration, Change of variables to polar, cylindrical and spherical coordinates, Finding areas (by double integrals) and volumes (by double integrals and triple integrals).

course_outcomes: Analyse various water treatment methods and boiler troubles.
Apply the knowledge of basic electrochemistry principles for electrochemical energy systems and corrosion.
Compare mechanistic aspects of polymerisation, and different polymers and conventional fuels for their effective utilisation.
Evaluate various modern engineering materials for their applications in engineering and other fields.

syllabus.title: Water Technology
syllabus.topics: Domestic water treatment – sedimentation, coagulation, disinfection by chlorination – breakpoint chlorination, desalination of brackish water – electrodialysis and reverse osmosis (RO). Industrial water: Hardness of water, Estimation of hardness by EDTA Method, Boiler troubles – scales, caustic embrittlement, Industrial water treatment – Ion-exchange method.

syllabus.title: Electrochemistry and Corrosion
syllabus.topics: Electrodes, electrochemical cell, Nernst equation, cell potential calculations, Primary cells – zinc-air battery, Secondary cells –lithium ion batteries; Fuel cells – hydrogen-oxygen fuel cell. Corrosion: Introduction, electrochemical corrosion, factors affecting corrosion, cathodic protection, copper electroplating and electroless plating.

syllabus.title: Polymer and Fuel Chemistry
syllabus.topics: Polymer Chemistry: Introduction, functionality of monomers, mechanism of chain growth, step growth polymerization, thermoplastics and thermosetting plastics: Preparation, properties and applications of PVC, polystyrene, Nylon 6,6 and Bakelite. Elastomers – Buna S and Buna N. Fuel Chemistry: Fuels- classification, calorific value, analysis of coal (proximate and ultimate analysis), refining of petroleum, knocking, octane and cetane number, alternative fuels –biomass, biogas, biodiesel.

syllabus.title: Modern Engineering Materials
syllabus.topics: Composites: classification – particle, fibre and layered reinforced composites, properties and engineering applications. Lubricants: classification, mechanisms, properties of lubricating oils. Building materials: Portland cement, constituents, setting and hardening of cement, refractories – classification and properties. Nanomaterials: classification, properties and applications.

course_outcomes: Apply different techniques to solve DC circuits.
Understand the magnetic circuit concepts.
Analyze the steady-state response, series, parallel AC circuits, mesh & nodal analysis, and resonance.
Apply network theorems for AC & DC circuits.
Demonstrate the working principles of basic Electronic devices, circuits and instrumentation System .
Implementation of simple Combinational and Sequential circuits using Logic gates.

syllabus.title: DC & AC Circuits
syllabus.topics: DC Circuits: Electrical circuit elements (R, L and C), Ohm’s Law, KCL & KVL, series, parallel, series-parallel circuits, Super Position theorem. AC Circuits: A.C. Fundamentals, relationship with phasor diagrams in R, L, and C circuits, Concept of Impedance, Active power, reactive power and apparent power, Concept of power factor. Equipment Safety Measures: Fuse and Miniature circuit breaker (MCB). Personal safety measures: Electric Shock, Earthing.

syllabus.title: Machines and Measuring Instruments
syllabus.topics: Machines: Construction, principle and operation of DC Motor, DC Generator, Single Phase Transformer, Three Phase Induction Motor and Alternator. Measuring Instruments: Construction and working principle of Voltage, Current, temperature sensors, multimeter. Electricity bill calculation.

syllabus.title: Semiconductor Devices
syllabus.topics: Characteristics of PN Junction Diode, Zener Diode. Bipolar Junction Transistor, CB, CE, CC Configurations and Characteristics, Small Signal CE Amplifier. Rectifiers and power supplies: full wave bridge rectifier, capacitor filter, zener voltage regulator. Amplifiers: Block diagram of Public Address system. Electronic Instrumentation.

syllabus.title: Digital Electronics
syllabus.topics: Overview of Number Systems, Logic gates including Universal Gates, BCD codes, Excess-3 code, Gray code, Hamming code. Boolean Algebra, Truth Tables. Simple combinational circuits–Half and Full Adders. Introduction to Flip flops, Registers and counters.

course_outcomes: To introduce students to the fundamentals of computer programming.
To provide hands-on experience with coding and debugging on control structures and arrays.
To foster logical thinking and problem-solving skills on strings and ponters.
To familiarize students with programming concepts such as functions, structures and files.

syllabus.title: Introduction to Programming and Problem Solving
syllabus.topics: History of Computers, Basic organization of a computer, Introduction to Programming Languages, Basics of a Computer Program- Algorithms, flowcharts, pseudo code. Introduction to Compilation and Execution, Primitive Data Types, Variables, and Constants, Basic Input and Output, Operations, Type Conversion, and Casting. Problem solving techniques: Algorithmic approach, characteristics of algorithm, Problem solving strategies: Top-down approach, Bottom-up approach, Time and space complexities of algorithms.

syllabus.title: Control Structures and Arrays
syllabus.topics: Simple sequential programs Conditional Statements (if, if-else, switch), Loops (for, while, do- while) Break and Continue, Arrays indexing, memory model, programs with array of integers, two dimensional arrays

syllabus.title: Strings and pointers
syllabus.topics: Introduction to Strings. Pointers, dereferencing and address operators, pointer and address arithmetic, array manipulation using pointers.

syllabus.title: Functions, User Defined Data types and File Handling
syllabus.topics: Introduction to Functions, Function Declaration and Definition, Function call Return Types and Arguments, modifying parameters inside functions using pointers, arrays as parameters. Scope and Lifetime of Variables, User-defined data types-Structures and Unions, Basics of File Handling

course_outcomes: Understand the principles of engineering drawing, including engineering curves and scales.
Draw and interpret orthographic projections of points, lines and planes in front, top and side views.
Understand and draw projection of solids in various positions in first quadrant and Explain principles behind development of surfaces.
Explain principles behind the Sections of solids, Prepare isometric views and conversion of simple solids.

syllabus.title: Introduction to Drawing, Curves, and Scales
syllabus.topics: Introduction: Lines, Lettering and Dimensioning, Geometrical Constructions of regular polygons by general methods. Curves: Construction of ellipse, parabola and hyperbola by general method and Involutes. Draw normal and tangent to Curves. Scales: Plain scales and diagonal scales.

syllabus.title: Orthographic Projections
syllabus.topics: Reference plane, Projections of a point in first quadrant. Projections of Straight Lines parallel to both planes, perpendicular to one plane and parallel to other, inclined to one plane and parallel to the other. Projections of Straight Line Inclined to both the reference planes. Projections of Planes: Regular planes perpendicular to both reference planes, parallel to one and inclined to the other; plane inclined to both the reference planes.

syllabus.title: Projections of Solids and Development of Surfaces
syllabus.topics: Projections of solids(Prisms and Pyramids only) in simple positions. Development of Surfaces: Methods of Development: Parallel line development and radial line development. Development of a cube, prism, cylinder, pyramid and cone. Computer graphics: Creating 2D & 3D drawings of objects using Auto CAD (Not for end examination).

syllabus.title: Sections of Solids, Isometric Views, and Conversion of Views
syllabus.topics: Sections of Solids: Section planes perpendicular to VP and inclined to HP only, Sectional views. Isometric Views: Draw an Isometric views of Simple solids. Conversion of Views: Conversion of isometric views to orthographic views of Simple solids.

textbooks: N. D. Bhatt, Engineering Drawing, Charotar Publishing House, 2016.

Select the right control structure for solving the problem.
Develop C programs which utilize memory efficiently using programming constructs like pointers.
Develop, Debug and Execute programs to demonstrate the applications of arrays, functions, basic concepts of pointers in C.

course_outcomes: Measure voltage, current and power in an electrical circuit
Measure of Resistance using Wheat stone bridge.
Discover critical field resistance and critical speed of DC shunt generators
Investigate the effect of reactive power and power factor in electrical loads
Identify & testing of various electronic components.
Understand the usage of electronic measuring instruments.
Plot and discuss the characteristics of various electron devices.
Explain the operation of a digital circuit.

Part B: Electronics Lab - V-I characteristics of PN Junction & Zener Diode, Implementation of rectifiers, Input & Output characteristics of BJT, Frequency response of CE amplifier, Simulation of RC coupled amplifier, Verification of Truth Table of Logic gates, Verification of Truth Tables of flip flops.

course_outcomes: Solve first order linear differential equations
Solve higher order linear differential equations with constant coefficients
Solve Partial differential equations
Evaluate the work done against field, circulation and flux using vector calculus

syllabus.title: Differential equations of first order and first degree
syllabus.topics: Linear differential equations – Bernoulli’s equations- Exact equations and equations reducible to exact form, Applications: Newton’s Law of cooling – Law of natural growth and decay- Electrical circuits.

syllabus.title: Linear differential equations of higher order (Constant Coefficients)
syllabus.topics: Definitions,homogenous and non-homogenous, complimentary function, general solution, particular integral, Wronskian, Method of variation of parameters, Simultaneous linear equations, Applications to L-CR Circuit problems and Simple Harmonic motion.

syllabus.title: Partial Differential Equations
syllabus.topics: Introduction and formation of Partial Differential Equations by elimination of arbitrary constants and arbitrary functions, solutions of first order linear equations using Lagrange’s method, Homogeneous Linear Partial differential equations with constant coefficients.

syllabus.title: Vector Calculus
syllabus.topics: Scalar and vector point functions, vector operator Del, Del applies to scalar point functions- Gradient, Directional derivative, del applied to vector point functions-Divergence and Curl, vector identities. Line integral-circulation-work done, surface integral-flux, Green’s theorem in the plane (without proof), Stoke’s theorem (without proof), volume integral, Divergence theorem (without proof) and related problems.

course_outcomes: Elaborate different types of lasers, optical fibers and their applications.
Familiarize with the basics of crystals and their structures.
Summarize various types of polarization of dielectrics and classify the magnetic materials.
Explain the basic concepts of Quantum Mechanics and types of semiconductors using Hall Effect.

syllabus.title: Lasers and Fiber Optics
syllabus.topics: Lasers: Introduction, Characteristics, Basic Principles, Requirements, Einstein’s coefficients, types of lasers (solid-state, gas, semiconductor), applications. Fibre Optics: Introduction, Fundamentals, Propagation of light, Types, Numerical aperture, Fiber optics in communication.

syllabus.title: Crystallography and X-ray diffraction
syllabus.topics: Crystallography: Space lattice, Basis, Unit Cell, lattice parameters, Bravais Lattices, crystal systems, coordination number, packing fraction (SC, BCC, FCC), Miller indices. X-ray diffraction: Bragg’s law, X-ray Diffractometer, crystal structure determination.

syllabus.title: Dielectric and Magnetic Materials
syllabus.topics: Dielectric Materials: Introduction, Dielectric polarization, polarizability, Susceptibility, Dielectric constant, Types of polarizations, Lorentz internal field, Clausius- Mossotti equation. Magnetic Materials: Introduction, Magnetic dipole moment, Magnetization, susceptibility, permeability, Classification of magnetic materials, Domain concept, Hysteresis.

syllabus.title: Quantum Mechanics and Semiconductors
syllabus.topics: Quantum Mechanics: Dual nature of light, Matter waves, Debroglie’s hypothesis, Heisenberg’s Uncertainty Principle, Schrodinger’s wave equations, Particle in a one-dimensional infinite potential well. Semiconductors: Formation of energy bands, Intrinsic and Extrinsic semiconductors, Fermi level, Drift and diffusion currents, Einstein’s equation, Hall effect, Photodiode, LED, Solar cell.

Know the basic concepts, uses and classification of surveying and realize the importance of Transportation in the nation's economy and the engineering measures related to Transportation and understand the importance of Water Storage and Conveyance Structures so that the social responsibilities of water conservation will be appreciated
Understand the scope of Mechanical Engineering in different sectors and industries and know about different manufacturing processes.
Explain the basics of thermal engineering, Power plants , power transmission and robotics.

course_outcomes: Analyze coplanar concurrent , parallel forces and evaluate centroid for plane figures
Analyze coplanar general case forces and evaluate moment of inertia for plane figures
Analyze rectilinear and curvilinear motion of particles
Evaluate the moment of inertia of material bodies and analyze the fixed axis rotation of rigid bodies.

syllabus.title: Equilibrium of Concurrent and Parallel Forces
syllabus.topics: Composition and resolution of forces, Free body diagram, Equilibrium of concurrent forces in a plane. Types of parallel forces, Resultant, Couple, Resolution of Force into force and a couple. Centroids of standard and composite figures.

syllabus.title: Friction and General Force Systems

Equilibrium of forces in plane-Analysis of plane trusses: Method of joints. Area Moments of Inertia: Definition, Polar Moment of Inertia, Transfer Theorem, Moments of Inertia of Composite Figures.

Kinetics of Curvilinear motion: D’Alembert’s Principle.

syllabus.topics: Stability definitions, Stability study based on poles of closed loop transfer function, Absolute and relative stability, Routh–Hurwitz criterion. Root Locus Technique: The root locus concept, Magnitude and angle conditions, Properties and construction of the root loci, Effect of adding poles and zeros to root locus

syllabus.title: Frequency Domain Analysis
syllabus.topics: Frequency domain specifications, Correlation between time and frequency response, Bode plot, Determination of phase margin and gain margin, Stability analysis from Bode plots, Polar plots, Nyquist stability criterion, Nyquist Plot.

textbooks: A.Anand Kumar, “Control Systems”, 2nd Ed., PHI, 2014
I J Nagrath& M Gopal, “Control Systems Engineering”, 5th Ed., New Age International, 2008
reference_books: Katsuhiko Ogata, “Modern Control Engineering”, 4th Ed., Pearson Education, 2003
A.NagoorKani, “Control Systems”, 2nd Ed., RBA Publications, 2006

course_outcomes: Explain the basic concepts of industrial process variables
Apply the concepts of industrial process variables to solve the engineering problems
Identify suitable transducer for measurement of industrial process variables
Analyze the performance of various measurement techniques in industrial process variables

syllabus.title: Temperature Measurement
syllabus.topics: Introduction, Classification of temperature sensors, Bimetals & Liquid-in-Glass thermometers, RTD, Thermistor, Thermocouples, IC sensors, Radiation pyrometers, Fiber-optic sensors, Quartz thermometer, Ultrasonic thermometer.

syllabus.title: Pressure Measurement
syllabus.topics: Introduction, pressure standards, Manometers; Force summing devices – Diaphragms, Bellows, Bourdon tubes; Secondary transducers – Resistive, Inductive, Capacitive, Piezoelectric and Hall Effect; Low pressure measurement - Mcleod, Knudsen, Pirani & Ionization gauges; Calibration of pressure gauges using dead weight tester.

syllabus.title: Flow Measurement
syllabus.topics: Introduction, Head type flow meters - Orifice plate, Venturi tube and Pitot tube; Variable area type flow meters – Rotameter; Velocity measurement type flow meters - Electromagentic, Turbine, Ultrasonic flow meters, Anemometers; Mass flow measurement type – Coriolis and Thermal mass flow meters; Positive displacement flow meters - Nutating disc and lobed impeller; Open channel flow meters- Weirs, Flumes.

syllabus.title: Level, Humidity, Density & Viscosity Measurement
syllabus.topics: Level Measurement: Introduction, Mechanical level indicators, Optical level sensors, Electrical type, Acoustic Level Sensors, Radiative methods. Humidity, Density & Viscosity Measurement: Introduction, Hygrometers, Moisture Analyzer, Densitometers, Viscometers.

textbooks: A.K.Ghosh, “Introduction to Measurements & Instrumentation”, IIIrd ed, PHI, 2009.
A.K.Sawhney & Puneet Sawhney,“A Course in Mechnanical Measuremnets & Instrumentation”, XIIth ed, Dhanapat Rai & Co., 2012.
reference_books: Ernest O Doebelin/Dhanesh, N Manik, “Measurement systems”, VIth ed,Tata Mc Grawhill.
C.S.Rangan, G.R.Sarma & V.S.V.Mani “Instrumentation Devices & Systems”, IInd ed, TMH, 2011.

course_outcomes: Apply suitable Null or Deflection type technique to measure prescribed electrical parameter.
Select a suitable digital instrument to measure physical and electrical parameters.
Compare the operation of various oscilloscopes and probes.
Explain the principles of various signal generators and wave analyzers.

syllabus.title: Electromechanical Indicating Instruments and Electrical Measurements
syllabus.topics: Suspension type galvanometer, Permanent magnet moving coil mechanism. DC ammeters, DC voltmeters, Series and Shunt type ohmmeter, Calibration of dc instruments, Alternating current indicating instruments - Electrodynamometer, Thermo Instruments, Electrodynamometers in power measurements, Watt hour meter, Power factor meters.

syllabus.title: Bridges and Electronic Instruments
syllabus.topics: Wheatstone bridge, Kelvin bridge, Maxwell bridge, Hay bridge, Schering bridge, Wien bridge, Wagner ground connection. Electronic Instruments: AC Voltmeter using rectifiers, True RMS voltmeter, Digital voltmeters, Q Meter, Analog pH meter.

syllabus.title: Oscilloscopes
syllabus.topics: Block diagram of oscilloscope, Cathode Ray Tube, Vertical amplifier, Horizontal deflecting system, Delay line in triggered sweep, Dual beam CRO, Dual trace oscilloscope, Sampling oscilloscope, Digital storage oscilloscope, Probes for CRO.

syllabus.title: Signal Generators and Wave Analyzers
syllabus.topics: Basic standard sine wave generator, Standard signal generator, Function generator, Laboratory square wave and pulse generator. Wave Analyzers: Basic wave analyzer, Frequency selective wave analyzer, Heterodyne wave analyzer, Harmonic distortion analyzers, Spectrum analyzer. Frequency Counters And Time-Interval Measurements.

textbooks: W D Cooper & A D Helfrick, “Electronic Instrumentation and Measurement Techniques”, PHI, 1998 (Unit-I)
H.S.Kalsi, “Electronic Instrumentation”, 2ndEd., TMH. (Units-II, III and IV)
reference_books: A.K. Sawhney, “A Course in Electrical and Electronic Measurements and Instrumentation”,Dhanpat Rai & Co
Oliver & Cage, “Electronic Measurements and Instrumentation”, Mc Graw Hill, 1975

course_outcomes: Present themselves effectively in the professional world by shedding off their inhibitions about communicating in English
Introduce themselves as well as others appropriately
Use vocabulary to form sentences and narrate stories by using creative thinking skills
Involve in practical activity-oriented sessions and respond positively by developing their analytical thinking
Learn about various expressions to be used in different situations

syllabus.topics: Introducing self & Others. Structures and forming sentences. Telephonic etiquette, Social etiquette and table manners. Practicing on functional conversations

Able to use the various looping constructs, arrays, matrices and clusters
Able to use various data plotting techniques and structures
Able to use the data acquisition device to acquire the measurement data from real world into PC

course_outcomes: Describe the fundamental concepts of Design Thinking and Innovation.
Apply the design thinking techniques for solving problems in various sectors.
Analyze the concepts of design thinking to work in a multidisciplinary environment.
Evaluate the value of creativity with design thinking concepts.

syllabus.title: Introduction to Design Thinking
syllabus.topics: Introduction to elements and principles of Design, basics of design-dot, line, shape, form as fundamental design components. Principles of design. Introduction to design thinking, history of Design Thinking, New materials in Industry.

syllabus.title: Design Thinking Process
syllabus.topics: Design thinking process (empathize, analyze, idea & prototype), implementing the process in driving inventions, design thinking in social innovations. Tools of design thinking - person, costumer, journey map, brainstorming, product development

syllabus.title: Innovation
syllabus.topics: Art of innovation, Difference between innovation and creativity, role of creativity and innovation in organizations. Creativity to Innovation. Teams for innovation, Measuring the impact and value of creativity.

syllabus.title: Product Design and Business Processes
syllabus.topics: Problem formation, introduction to product design, Product strategies, Product value, Product planning, product specifications. Innovation towards product design Case studies. Design Thinking applied in Business & Strategic Innovation, Design Thinking principles that redefine business – Business challenges. Design thinking to meet corporate needs. Design thinking for Startups. Defining and testing Business Models and Business Cases. Developing & testing prototypes.
